description:
Coccidioides posadasii RMSCC 2133 is a species of fungus that belongs to the genus Coccidioides. It is a dimorphic fungus, meaning it can exist in two different forms: a mycelial form and a spherical, spore-producing form known as a spherule.

Coccidioides posadasii RMSCC 2133 is a causative agent of the disease coccidioidomycosis, also known as Valley Fever. This fungus is found in the soil of certain geographic regions, primarily in the southwestern United States and parts of Mexico and Central America.

The RMSCC 2133 strain is a specific isolate of Coccidioides posadasii that has been used in research and studies to understand the biology, epidemiology, and pathogenesis of this fungus. It serves as a model organism for investigating the mechanisms of infection, host-pathogen interactions, and potential therapeutic interventions for coccidioidomycosis.

Understanding the characteristics and behavior of Coccidioides posadasii RMSCC 2133 is crucial for developing effective strategies to prevent and manage the disease caused by this fungal pathogen.
